common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App, including connection errors preventing local LLM downloads, non-dismissable overlay messages, and requests for adding new script languages. Troubleshooting involves gathering user logs, providing relevant resources, and investigating the reported problems. Solutions vary depending on the specific issue.

related_issues.title: Adding a script language to the supported languages
related_issues.text:
Adding a script language to the supported languages ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/1
Originally posted by **ddasberg** January 21, 2025 Is it possible to add a script language to the supported languages? If so, what kind of files or information are necessary? We have develeoped a script-language for database-applications for Windows named "CARA". Our complete Windows-ERP-System has been written in CARA. It would be nice to have Pieces-support for the language.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * User @ddasberg reported a problem requiring support. * The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team for investigation. **Problems Identified:** * The user experienced an issue requiring support from the Pieces team. * The nature of the issue is not revealed in the conversation excerpt. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * The Pieces support bot provided helpful resources, including existing issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel. * The language support team member assigned to the issue acknowledged the user's report and added the feature request internally. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The user's issue is being investigated by the Pieces team. * The specific solution or resolution remains unclear from the provided conversation excerpt. **Additional Notes:** * The conversation indicates the user's issue involved language support. * The user should expect further communication from the Pieces team within 24 hours.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@AmanSingh766) is experiencing an exception when downloading local LLMs.
* The error message mentions a connection closure before receiving a full header.
* The user is unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.

**Problems Identified:**

* Local LLMs cannot be downloaded due to a connection closure error.
* The Pieces Copilot Service is inaccessible.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support requested:
    * Support logs from Pieces OS (zipped folder from c:/user/${USER}/Documents/com.pieces.os/Support)
    * Confirmation whether the error occurs every time a local LLM download is attempted.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User has not yet responded to the support request.
* The issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Information:**

* The user was provided with links to related issues and helpful resources.
* The user was informed that their issue would be resolved within 24 hours.

## Important Note

**This information is based on the provided conversation only. Further updates or information may be available in the full GitHub issue.**

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Conversation

**Key Point:** @ThemePark reported an issue related to the Pieces Desktop App. 

**Problem:** The app is unable to open.

**Solutions Proposed:**
- pieces-support-bot suggests related issues and helpful resources but doesn't offer a direct solution.
- mack-at-pieces asks clarifying questions to diagnose the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
 - No conclusive solution has been implemented.
 - mack-at-pieces is investigating further by gathering information from @ThemePark. 

**Additional Notes:** 
- This conversation is only an excerpt and may not include all relevant information.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Copilot and App Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report "Something went wrong" errors, connection issues with local LLMs, and non-dismissable overlay messages.  Suggested solutions include checking API keys, updating Pieces OS, signing in, and switching models.  However, issues persist for some users, requiring further investigation and support from developers.

related_issues.title: Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
related_issues.text:
Copilot Bug: 'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...' copilot response
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key points raised:**
* Users experiencing "Something went wrong with processing" error.
* Issue seems to be related to OpenAI API key usage and specific model selection (Claude and Gemini).
* Potential solutions suggested include removing API key, updating to latest version, switching model to GPT4o, and ensuring Pieces login.

**Problems identified:**
* OpenAI API keys causing failures.
* Issues with Claude and Gemini models.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* Remove OpenAI API key.
* Update to version 11.0.3.
* Sign in to Pieces.
* Switch model to GPT4o.

**Current status/outcome:**
* Problem persists for some users despite suggested solutions.
* Mark, a developer, available for real-time troubleshooting.

**Additional notes:**
* Issue appears to be ongoing as of January 22, 2025, requiring further investigation.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Conversation

**Key Point:** @ThemePark reported an issue related to the Pieces Desktop App. 

**Problem:** The app is unable to open.

**Solutions Proposed:**
- pieces-support-bot suggests related issues and helpful resources but doesn't offer a direct solution.
- mack-at-pieces asks clarifying questions to diagnose the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
 - No conclusive solution has been implemented.
 - mack-at-pieces is investigating further by gathering information from @ThemePark. 

**Additional Notes:** 
- This conversation is only an excerpt and may not include all relevant information.

recommendations: **Prioritize 'Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues'**: This is the most common issue category, impacting both Pieces OS and Desktop App users. Focus on resolving connection errors, overlay messages, and consider expanding supported script languages.

**Investigate 'Pieces OS Copilot and App Connection Issues'**: Address the root cause of "Something went wrong" errors and connection issues with local LLMs.  Review API key functionality, model compatibility (Claude, Gemini), and ensure smooth update processes.
**Improve communication around non-dismissable overlay messages**: Provide clearer messaging and solutions within the app to prevent user confusion and unnecessary restarts.

**Review and update troubleshooting documentation**: Ensure resources effectively address common issues like connection errors, local LLM downloads, and overlay messages. Include steps for checking API keys, updating software, and switching models.
**Gather more detailed user logs**: Improve logging mechanisms to capture more specific error information, aiding in faster diagnosis and resolution.
**Consider a dedicated support channel for Pieces OS and Copilot**: This would allow for specialized support and faster response times for these specific issues.
**Proactively monitor for emerging issues**: Implement systems to track error reports and user feedback for early identification and resolution of potential problems.
**Enhance user feedback mechanisms**: Make it easier for users to report issues, provide feedback, and access support resources directly within the app.
